question: A patient presents with cutaneous vasculitis, glomerulonephritis and peripheral neuropathy. What investigation is to be performed next for work up?
exp: C-ANCA (Ag against which C ANCA is directed against is -Proteinase 3) P-ANCA - (Ag against which P ANCA is directed against is -MPO)

question: Hypertension with hypokalemic alkalosis is seen in?
exp: Liddle syndrome Gain of function of epithelial Na+ channels. More salt & water accumulating in body - Hypertension Loss of K+ and H+- Hypokalemic alkalosis Gitelman Defect in DCT Salt wasting, polyurea - BP cannot be | Baer Defect in thick ascending limb of loop of Henle Salt wasting, polyuria Normotension or | B. P | Aldosterone (2deg Aldosteronium) Hypokalemic, M. Alkalosis Fanconi syndrome/Renal tubular acidosis Type 2 Etiology- Wilson disease/Expiry date Tetracycline C/F: - Bicarbonaturia, salt wasting, M.
